Created attachment 575147
firefox_shellext_fail.zip

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1) AppleWebKit/535.2 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/15.0.874.120 Safari/535.2

Steps to reproduce:

Register a custom Windows Shell Overlay Icon Extension that writes a Registry Entry to HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\CLSID\{-Guid of the ShellExtension-}\InProcServer32. If this Key doesn't contain the Attribute 'ThreadingModel' (Value of ThreadingModel doesn't matter)  FireFox / Thunderbird will fail to start. However the Shell Extension works fine with Windows Explorer without the 'ThreadingModel' Attribute present. 

See attached *.reg files to reproduce the problem (first merge "firefox_registry_fail.reg", try to start firefox / thunderbird; kill the process; merge "firefox_working.reg"; try to start Firefox / Thunderbird -> now works!). 


Actual results:

Firefox / Thunderbird doesn't show any GUI, but the process is running (visible in taskmgr).


Expected results:

Firefox / Thunderbird should handle this problem, ignore the Shellextension if necessary and start normally with GUI. The Problem is pretty mean as it isn't obvious at all that registering the custom Windows Shellextension is the cause for Firefox / Thunderbird not starting up correctly.
